title: Bernie Sanders will attend October debate after heart procedure
text:
WASHINGTON After canceling several campaign events following a heart procedure, Sen. Bernie Sanders will participate in the upcoming Democratic primary debate,his campaign confirmed to USA TODAY Thursday.

Sanders, 78, had two stents insertedearlier this week after doctors found blockage in one artery. His campaign saidWednesday that he experiencedchest discomfort during a campaign event Tuesday evening in Las Vegas.

The debate will be held on Oct. 15 atOtterbein University in Westerville, Ohio.CNN and The New York Times will behostingthe debate, which will air live at 8 p.m. ET.

Sanders' wife, Jane, in a statement Thursday said the Vermont Senator's doctors "are pleased with his progress, and there has been no need for any additional procedures."

More: 2020 White House hopeful Bernie Sanders hospitalized after suffering chest pains

"Bernie is up and about," she said in the statement. "Yesterday, he spent much of the day talking with staff about policies, cracking jokes with the nurses and doctors,and speaking with his family on the phone."

The senator will likely be discharged before the end of the weekend and will be heading back to Burlington where he will take a few days to rest, the statement said. Jane Sanders said her husband is "ready to get back out there and is looking forward to the October debate.

Sanders, who ran for president in 2016, has been consistently among the top three Democratic contenders. He currently stands inthird place in national polling,according to a Real Clear Politics' averaging of major polls.
